title: WTF...We can't see profiles?

content: I wonder if it has anything to do with the habit some people have of denigrating the service of those who have served honorably? I myself have been subjected to such an event. Although I served 26.5 years, and was honorably retired, the career I selected in 1981 happend to be one that, as an E-7 and E-8 since 9/11/2001, didn't end up sending me to the OEF/OIF AORs. This isn't to say I didn't support OEF/OIF in the jobs I was in; I did. But I've had people refer to my profile and suggest that my service didn't mean as much as those whose boots were on the ground. Ironic, actually, as some of the things my units did undoubtedly helped save many of those lives or make their missions successful. I thought there was something in the TOS about not denigrating the service of others, but when I searched for that, I couldn't find it. My protest to the Mods was met with, "Tough shiite." But now I wonder if perhaps this is part of the reason for the limited profile view.
reply: I wonder if it has anything to do with the habit some people have of denigrating the service of those who have served honorably? I myself have been subjected to such an event. Although I served 26.5 years, and was honorably retired, the career I selected in 1981 happend to be one that, as an E-7 and E-8 since 9/11/2001, didn't end up sending me to the OEF/OIF AORs. This isn't to say I didn't support OEF/OIF in the jobs I was in; I did. But I've had people refer to my profile and suggest that my service didn't mean as much as those whose boots were on the ground. Ironic, actually, as some of the things my units did undoubtedly helped save many of those lives or make their missions successful. I thought there was something in the TOS about not denigrating the service of others, but when I searched for that, I couldn't find it. My protest to the Mods was met with, "Tough shiite." But now I wonder if perhaps this is part of the reason for the limited profile view.

content: Personally I don't have much room to b*tch. I've received two e-mails from military.com since the first of the year soliciting input for their efforts to upgrade the site. I didn't respond ... but apparently enough people did or have otherwise commented over time so that they are undertaking some changes. Having not put my oar in the water when I had the chance, I'll at least do the site management the courtesy of waiting for the completion of the overhaul before pitching a fit. Having said that, I've been bitten by promises made before ... and not kept ... by this site's management. I hope they live up to MaineDawg's expectations.
